Event.0: Actress Gwyneth Paltrow and singer Chris Martin divorce after 12 years of marriage
Event.1: The online microblogging service Twitter was publicly launched, and within the following decade it had more than 300 million users.
Event.2: Italian fashion designer Gianni Versace was murdered by serial killer Andrew Cunanan.
Event.3: Prince Charles and Princess Diana sign divorce papers
Event.4: "Die Hard" directed by John McTiernan and starring Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman is released in the US
Event.5: American singer-songwriter Bob Dylan performed in England before 200,000 people.
Event.6: British Open Golf, St Andrews: Jack Nicklaus completes 3rd career grand slam; wins by 2 strokes from Ben Crenshaw & Ray Floyd
Event.7: "Honky Chateau" becomes Elton John's first No. 1 album in the US, includes hit "Rocket Man"
Event.8: Actress Joan Rivers (32) weds TV producer Edgar Rosenberg
Event.9:
Close-up pictures of Mars provided by Mariner 4
Mariner 4, an unmanned space probe launched by NASA in 1964, flew by Mars and returned close-up pictures of its surface on this day in 1965, the pictures proving that the planet's rumoured canals were actually illusions.
Event.10: 18 Nobel laureates sign the Mainau Declaration against nuclear weapons, later co-signed by 34 more laureates
Event.11: Gerald Lascelles, son of English Princess Mary, weds Angela Dowding
Event.12:
Jesse Ventura
American professional wrestler, actor, and politician
was born
Event.13:
Linda Ronstadt
American singer
was born
Event.14:
Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Muʿizzaddin Waddaulah
sultan of Brunei
was born
Event.15:
Ali Khamenei
rahbar of Iran
was born
Event.16:
Jacques Derrida
French philosopher
was born
Event.17: Leon Max Lederman, who was a corecipient of the 1988 Nobel Prize for Physics for research on neutrinos, was born in New York City.
Event.18: American Jim Thorpe won a gold medal for the decathlon at the Olympics in Stockholm; he also captured a gold medal for the pentathlon.
Event.19: Circus performer Charles Stratton, known to the world as General Tom Thumb, died.
Event.20: The Rosetta Stone is found in the Egyptian village of Rosetta by French Captain Pierre-François Bouchard during Napoleon's Egyptian Campaign
Event.21: "Blood Wedding" of Astorre Baglione & Lavinia Colonna in Perugia family Baglione massacre
Event.22: Battle of Grunwald (First Battle of Tannenburg, Battle of Žalgiris), one of Medieval Europe's largest battles during Poland-Lithuanian Teutonic War. Polish King Władysław Jagiełło and Lithuanian Grand Duke Vytautas defeat Teutonic Ulrich von Jungingen
Event.23: John Ball, a leader in the Peasants' Revolt, is hung, drawn and quartered in the presence of Richard II of England
Event.24: City of Jerusalem is captured and plundered by Christian forces during the First Crusade
